Posts.Content: curepink wrote: Good day to everyone and god bless you all. My mom had breast cancer in her left side in 1993 when i was 2 years old and she had a surgery to remove her left breast back home(developing country) but they didnt do any chemotheraphy or radiation after the surgery. They didnt even put her on any medication. Then we came to Canada in 2001. In 2008 she was having pain in her left arm and later we found out she has lymphedema because of cancer in her left chest wall area which was blocking one of the lymp nodes and her left hand became so big. She seen a oncologist and he put her on to tamoxfen. For year and a half she was doing fine  with no side effects but she was having pain because of lyphedema and the cancer didnt spread anywhere. In 2010 she had another tumor in her armpit and the doctor changed the medication to letrozole. After she started this medication she was having alots of pain in her lymphedema hand so we went to the emergency and they told us she is having blood clot in her hand and they put her on innohep syringes. She takes them everyday. The tumor under her armpit opened up and she was having discharged and because of this a nurse would come and do dressings for the wound. Then we did do a bone test, chest test and a x ray to check if they spread to anywhere else and they all came normal. And the oncologist suggested we wait 3 months and see how the (letrozole)medication is doing and if it dosent seems working we would have to do chemotheraphy. Two weeks ago she was having another lump in the middle of her chest so we went to the emergency and they said it could be cancer in one of the lympnodes. So now the oncologist told us she would have to start on chemotheraphy next week and he told us he would put her on DOXORUBICIN and CYCLOPHOSPHAMIDE I.V. I am so worried about her. If someone out there that had same problem or used the same medication please help me out i need some experienced person's advise. Or if anyone that used these medication please let me know how did they work for you, any side effects, etc.. ANY INFORMATION WOULD BE HELPFUL. i would be waiting for your responses. Thankyou very much and god bless you all. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Concerned Son curepink justjudie

Posts.Content: Mar 2, 2011 03:40PM curepink wrote: The cancer blockage was around thhe chest area under her left collarbone. and the tumor under her lympnode is under her left arm. If that helps. Godbless you all. Thankyou
Posts.Title: Stage 4 or not???? curepink MJLToday

Posts.Content: curepink wrote: Hi my mom had cancer in 1993 and she had surgery to remove her left breast and they didnt put her on any medication or chemotheraphy. But in 2008 She got lymphedemia becuase of cancer blockage in the same left chest and the oncologist put her on tomoxifen. It worked great for year and a half. Then she got another tumor under her lympnodes and the oncologist swithced the medication to letrozole(ferma). I  asked the oncologist what stage the cancer is at now and he told me stage 4 and when i heard that i was shocked because isnt stage 4 when the cancer spread to other oragns? Can someone help me with this problem?  Thankyou i will be checking every five mintutes for anyone's help. If you have any question will replie right away. Godbless you. Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Mar 2, 2011 04:15PM curepink wrote: No there isnt cany cancer in her bones, liver or lungs. We just had a alots of tests. Thank god. The cancer is in her breast area in her lympnodes. Thankyou lowrider for your support.
Posts.Title: Stage 4 or not???? curepink MJLToday

Posts.Content: curepink wrote: My mom is having hard time breathing so we went to the ER. They checked her blood level because she is on toxatere and also had an x tray done. They came told us how everything looks normal and that she is low on fluids. They gave her more fluids. When we walked in the ER her oxygen level was 75 which was too low they told me that normal oxygen level should be 95-100. They told us to stay overnight and we'll do a ctscan and check what's the problem. Did any1 experience this? Any advice wud be helpful. Could this be because of lung mets? She did cough little bit . I am freaking ouut can anyone help me? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Low oxygen level curepink 2Hands4me

Posts.Content: Jul 2, 2011 12:48AM curepink wrote: My was had surgery for breast cancer 1993. But two years ago it came back around her chest wall because of that tumor she has lymphedemia. She was on tomoxfine for year and a half after it stopped working and the cancer spread to her lymphnodes. So onc switched to letrozole but it didn't work and the cancer spread to her sternum. We started chemo AC did 5 rounds but then the cancer started to spread so we changed it to toxetere. Now after 2 rounds of toxetere she is having this problem. I hope this information help you. Thankyou guys for repling I am at the hospital can't sleep waiting for any help.
Posts.Title: Low oxygen level curepink 2Hands4me

Posts.Content: Jul 2, 2011 11:19AM curepink wrote: I talked to the onc he told me they don't know if she has pneumonia because of the surgery scars and they don't want to give her a MRI because she is so weak and they don't want to expose her to radiation. So he told me she should stay here for another day or two and take some antibiotics to see if she feels better. Thank you guys for your support I will keep you updated.
